title: If parents do not allow her to 𝒘𝒆𝒂𝒓 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒏𝒊𝒒𝒂𝒃, is she sinful if she listens to them?
transcript:
I had a question regarding if a 
parent is not necessarily discouraging but they're pushing you to not wear the Niqab. They're not letting you wear the Niqab 
at all costs and they've removed you from being able to wear gloves and they're telling 
you to wear the Hijab or at least a [ ] dress. Are you sinful if you were to listen? Okay, so this is commonly happening 
unfortunately in some households. The parents do not believe in niqab and do 
not endorse their daughters wearing the gloves and sometimes they fight and intimidate 
and threaten. So what is to be done? This is not a one-size-fits-all. A girl has 
to look seriously into the consequences. The general idea is there is no obedience 
to anyone in disobeying Allah, end of story. If they tell you to wear 
mini skirts is this halal? You would say "Oh no way I'm not going to do this 
even if they slaughter me" (Figure of Speech) Good, what about maxis? No, 
I will not expose my feet. What about short sleeves, no 
half sleeves maybe to here. So what's the red line that 
you would say 'yes' or 'no'? It's the Sharia'h, it's not 
based on my whims and desires so if your conviction is that wearing the niqab 
is mandatory which is the most authentic opinion and covering the hands whether with gloves or 
with your Abayah is the most authentic opinion then you have to follow that. Let's look into the consequences, if your father 
is a tyrant, he's a nutcase, he's a lunatic. He would probably harm you or probably do 
something that's illegal or inflict damage. In this case, you're oppressed and you're 
compelled to obey within the limits up to necessity. So yes I may have to take 
off my niqab if I'm with him   but if I'm going to school 
or to work or somewhere else and he's not with me I fully cover so I have to 
reduce the damage to the best amount possible. If he's just saying things without carrying 
them through, dogs that bark don't bite So you should not be intimidated and 
you should try to remain steadfast and holding your grounds and 
may Allah make things easy.
